intro: Campanula rentoniae, commonly known as the Welsh bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Wales. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Campanula rentoniae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
